summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of three labor confirmation features - all functionality working correctly
passed_tests: extractLaborEstimate: parses 'Estimated total labor: 1.5 hours' from LLM response
extractLaborEstimate: parses 'Total labor: 3.0 hours' and various formats
parseLaborConfirmation: parses '2.0 hours' as override, standalone numbers, embedded numbers
parseLaborConfirmation: 'confirm'/'ok'/'yes'/'да'/'sí' returns current estimate
parseLaborConfirmation: short ambiguous messages treated as confirmation
validateLaborSum: valid when breakdown sums to confirmed total
validateLaborSum: invalid when breakdown sums higher than confirmed total
validateLaborSum: invalid when step sum drifts from confirmed total
validateLaborSum: complex AC breakdown sums correctly
validateLaborConfirmationOutput: valid contains estimate and confirmation prompt
validateLaborConfirmationOutput: invalid missing estimate pattern or confirmation prompt
Labor store operations: setLaborEstimate, confirmLabor, getConfirmedHours work correctly
Labor store: confirmed hours override estimate, stores timestamps
CaseMode includes 'labor_confirmation' - validateOutput and getSafeFallback handle it
Copy button per-message state tracking with copiedMessageId
Copy button auto-reset after 1.5s timeout works correctly
Copy button visual feedback: 'Copy' → 'Copied!' with checkmark → auto-reset
Copy button different message tracking (copying one doesn't affect others)
Report copy button has independent state from inline copy buttons
Clipboard integration with proper error handling
Mode validators properly handle labor_confirmation mode
All 394 vitest unit tests pass (32 labor-confirmation + 9 copy-button-ux + 29 mode-validators + others)
Feature implementation validation: all required functions present in labor-store.ts
Labor confirmation flow: diagnostic → labor_confirmation → final_report with constraint
Labor sum validation ensures breakdown matches confirmed total exactly
